fields.summary: Stale hg processes with 100% CPU

fields.description: I have files with long file paths, and files with a long lines of code written big so I can see them. As such, in the File Status view, having the list of files to stage on the right side rather than the bottom takes away a lot of the window without adding any value, there is a lot of dead space on the staging file sidebar that I wish I could use for code.
fields.summary: The staged files sidebar should be laid out at the bottom of the window not on the side

fields.description: I have big files with a lot of changes to commit, often those lines are not in the same hunk and even when they are, they are not consecutive. It makes staging changes very slow that no only you do not allow staging non-consecutive lines, but you also add an alert on top of that to complain that my changes are not consecutive!
fields.summary: You can't stage lines that are not consecutive

fields.description: When using Tabs on Mac, when I reopen SourceTree, each tab that had been opened is opened as a new single tab window, instead of the window containing all of the tabs.
fields.summary: Tabs not reopened correctly on Mac

fields.description:
As with version 2.5 (104) for Mac there is a new bug into Account management that disables the save button as soon as a user starts to type in the username.
 
 Tested on El Capitan (10.11) and Sierra (10.12)
 
 Steps to reproduce:
 1. Open Preferences
 2. Navigate to Accounts
 3. Click on Add...
 4. Select Bitbucket Server
 5. Type the server address (it does not matter if it is ssh or https)
 6. Start to write into Username field
 7. The Save button grays out.

h3. *Update:*
The same issue happen when trying to add Bitbucket Cloud Account using _HTTPS Basic Auth_

h3. Workaround
# Enter all the information needed
# Switch to other _Host_
# Switch it back to the preferred _Host_
# Click _Save_
fields.summary: Unable to save username in Account settings

fields.description:
Note: actual version ist 2.4.1-MAC, but this is not selectable from the dropdown!
 
 When trying to add a Subtree to a current repository clicking on the globe button to browse hosted repositories the list is empty (see screenshot_1).
 
 Accounts are correctly configured and the main SourceTree window correctly lists remote repos (e.g. on my BitBucket Server - see screenshot_2)
fields.summary: When trying to add Subtree/Link to a repository remote repositories are not listed

fields.description: Please introduce setting to set clone-depth on a repo
fields.summary: Please introduce setting to set clone-depth on a repo

fields.description:
I could reproduce this error/bug in SourceTree for a different setup (also still valid for 2.5 (104)):
 # Take an GitHub account with username *xyz*
 # Create an OAuth Authentication with username *xyz* and the same key 
 # Repeat the step above for Bitbucket also with username *xyz*

*Result:* the authentication will always fail for the second account added with the following error log:
{code:java}
2017-04-16 07:26:53 +0000 (e) Error fetching password for SourceTree (OAuth) account with username xyz.
Error Description - The specified item already exists in the keychain.
2017-04-16 07:27:04 +0000 (e) [AUTH] Error: Cannot Authorize (Bitbucket)
2017-04-16 07:27:04 +0000 (e) Fetching User owned repositories for Bitbucket cloud account failed. Error - Could not authorize request with the available token. Please re-authenticate.
2017-04-16 07:27:09 +0000 () [AUTH] beginning authentication for Bitbucket account
2017-04-16 07:27:12 +0000 (e) [AUTH] sign-in failed with error: The operation couldn’t be completed. (com.google.GTMOAuth2 error -1000.)
{code}
It seems as the key for the account is somehow related to the username, instead of the username and a unique account id.

Any comments on that?
fields.summary: Accessing GitHub and Bitbuckt via OAuth with same username fails

fields.description:
"External Diff" should not silently fail if FileMerge is not installed then should 

opendiff aka FileMerge is installed as part of X Code, which I don't have installed nor do I want to install.

*Additional Details*

Related to STSP-6506 {{By default SourceTree on Mac should not set global git difftool.sourcetree.cmd=opendiff if X Code is not installed}}
fields.summary: "External Diff" should not silently fail if FileMerge is not installed then should

fields.description: I have too many windows open; supporting tabs would be a great thing.
fields.summary: Add tabs to the UI

fields.description:
Company password to SVN expired, new one was created. I did not get any GUI prompt to change the password in SourceTree. Trying a pull/fetch request would run indefinitely. Using git to SVN.

Observed in visible log of the locked up pull request. It would never pass these lines. git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false svn fetch Authentication realm: [https://ny-svn.somewebsite.com:443|https://ny-svn.somewebsite.com/] CollabNet Subversion Repository

Running the terminal command "git svn fetch" prompted a password dialog. After that, it worked. I would expect the GUI to popup for a password failure.
fields.summary: Add a prompt to SourceTree GUI when a new password for SVN was created or a password failure message

fields.description: I recommend you make it possible to ignore entire folders in a project. I can't imagine that would be difficult at all, and it seems like an obvious feature that arguably should have been there long ago. You can only ignore individual files, but that's not very helpful when you have entire folders with thousands of files that would take a lifetime to ignore one by one. Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow entire folders to be ignored

fields.description:
I found that problem one week ago.
 The problem persist although I restart sourcetree.

Steps:
 1) Do changes on your code
 2)Go to commit changes and uncheck "Push immediately..."
 3)Press Commit button.
 
 I just update to 2.5 but the problem persist.
fields.summary: Although I uncheck the check "Push changes immediately..." when I commit, the commit is pushed always.

fields.description:
# I clone a git-lfs repository enabled from a Bitbucket server via HTTPS 
 # SourceTree opens the repository and asks me to activate git-lfs
 # I press ok. I get a password prompt.
 ## if "save password in keychain" is selected, the prompt comes up again and again... (Console sees a crash of the git-credential-sourcetree)
 ## If "save password in keychain" is deselected, i need to enter the password for each file which is pulled via git-lfs

*Workaround*: if i run a git lfs pull on command line onces, it all seems fine. After this the password gets stored in keychain and sourcetree seems able to use that.

*Crashlog for git-credential-sourcetree* :

Terminating app due to uncaught exception 'NSInvalidArgumentException', reason: '*** -[NSPlaceholderMutableString initWithString:]: nil argument'

First throw call stack:

(

0   CoreFoundation                      0x00007fffd257537b __exceptionPreprocess + 171

1   libobjc.A.dylib                     0x00007fffe736948d objc_exception_throw + 48

2   CoreFoundation                      0x00007fffd25f3c3d +[NSException raise:format:] + 205

3   Foundation                          0x00007fffd3ee5df1 -[NSPlaceholderMutableString initWithString:] + 96

4   Foundation                          0x00007fffd3f236e4 +[NSString stringWithString:] + 45

5   git-credential-sourcetree           0x000000010b4f287e git-credential-sourcetree + 108670

6   git-credential-sourcetree           0x000000010b4f26a4 git-credential-sourcetree + 108196

7   git-credential-sourcetree           0x000000010b4f422f git-credential-sourcetree + 115247

8   git-credential-sourcetree           0x000000010b4f415f git-credential-<…>
fields.summary: Keychain Problems with git-lfs and git

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding an account for Bitbucket Server in SourceTree, the 'Host' field accepts only the web URL, the SSH format doesn't work (even if you select SSH as protocol).

However, when a user selects 'SSH' as protocol, the suggested text in the 'Host' field indicates an SSH format:  !Screen Shot 2017-04-11 at 10.23.54.png|thumbnail! 

 which is confusing for users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the suggested text in 'Host' field to be the Web URL, instead of the SSH base url.
fields.summary: Fix the suggested URL in Host when adding a Bitbucket Server account with SSH

fields.description:
I used to be able to use Sourcetree to create new repositories where the Name field contained spaces and caps like "My New Repository 1".  This would create a new repository that would show up in my Bitbucket profile with a pretty name "My New Repository 1" but the slug would automatically be "my-new-repository-1."

Now when I try to create new repositories like this, I get one of two error messages. If the name of the new repository contains spaces "My New Repository" I get this error: `The operation couldn’t be completed. (com.google.GTMSessionFetcher error -1.)`

If the name of the new repository does not contain spaces but does contain a number like "MyRepository2", I get this error: `message: Invalid slug. Slugs must be lowercase, alphanumerical, and may also contain underscores, dashes, or dots.`

Apparently Sourcetree's autoupdater was broken so I only recently upgraded from 2.0.5.2b0 to 2.5 so I can't say when this bug appeared. I'm connected with Bitbucket over ssh, not sure if that matters. I can replicate this behavior on a different Mac with an unrelated Bitbucket account connected in the same way.
fields.summary: Cannot create new remote repositories with caps, spaces, or numbers

fields.description:
This issue tested on version 2.4 and the new one, 2.5, on Mac but I think is also affecting the other versions.
 
 Here is the issue description:
 
 Due to some security policy inside the company where I work, I have to connect SourceTree applications to a test BitBucket server that is behind an Apache server with proxypass configured. The Apache server has a virtual host configured that has a public signed SSL certificate and require also client certificates.
 
 The git client is working without any issue after it is configured with command 
 git config --global httpCert "<cn>" 
 (also works with local after the repository is downloaded from BitBucket server).
 
 It works as expected when I configure SourceTree account to use BitBucket server and I disable client certificate authentication on Apache server, but as soon as reactivate the client certificate authentication it fails with the message seen in the print screen attached.
 
 Is the SourceTree application capable to send client certificate when it is required to ?
fields.summary: Failed to use client certificate to authenticate to BitBucket server

fields.description: Ability to change the commit time's format to 24-hours format
fields.summary: Customer Request: Ability to change time format to 24 hours format

fields.description:
When I am typing shortcuts for gitmoji — e.g. :memo: for 📝 — in the commit message field, the shortcut will not expand immediately, as everywhere in the system. Sometimes it expands after a lot of spaces, sometimes never.

BG: We use standard Markdown with preview so the text auto-replacement in use is conflicting with it.
fields.summary: Mac: Typing gitmoji shortcuts unreliable

fields.description: The number of changes on the window "Repo browser" fall out the grey circle if the name of repository is too long and the window has a minimal size.
fields.summary: The number of changes on the window "Repo browser" fall out the grey circle if the name of repository too long

fields.description:
I'm using the File Log View and Blame to trace a change in the code. At one point, the file is renamed, so only appears in the File Log View if Follow Renames is checked. After checking Follow Renames and finding the next earlier revision to Blame, I select Blame Selected, but an error dialog appears with:

Error encountered

'git blame' failed with code 128:'fatal: no such path new/path/filename.py in abcdef'

Where new/path/filename.py is the current name of the file but at this revision, the filename is old/path/filename.py.

It would be nice if, since sourcetree is following the renamed files if it would use the old name, because the blame will never work for the target hash with the new name.
fields.summary: Blaming renamed file in File log view results in error

fields.description:
I'm running SourceTree version 2.5 (102) on mac os El capitan 10.11.6.

A symbolic link to another file in the git was replaced with a real file, the File Status View didn't show the change.
I had to go to the terminal to add and commit the file by hand.
Once the change was committed, I was able to see the change in the History View.
fields.summary: File Status View doesn't show a link changed to actual file
Add GitlabHG as Hosted Repository Service - Make it for Windows too

fields.description:
Save button becomes disabled when trying to add bitbucket server account.

!bbs.png|width=353,height=168!
fields.summary: Save button disabled when trying to add Bitbucket Server account.

fields.description:
I tried to clone a repository using SSH and got the authentication dialog, but then realized I wanted to change my SSH configuration and needed to cancel the operation. I had to click Cancel through at least 10 separate authentication dialogs. If authentication fails, SourceTree should present a dialog allowing the user to choose between trying authentication again or allowing the operation to fail. (If this behavior is caused by OS X’s ssh-agent, not SourceTree, please let me know so I can file a bug against Apple.)

I’m running OS X 10.11.5 (15F34) (El Capitan), in case this is OS-level stupidity.
fields.summary: Allow the user to abort an operation upon authentication problems, rather than try 10 times

fields.description:
I have access to a Bitbucket server (locally hosted) and have access to a repository, but did not have a valid SSH key registered with the server. When I tried to clone the repository (unintentionally using SSH), I got a rather unhelpful error message: “This is not a valid source path/URL”. The details button shows me {code}Permission denied (publickey).
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.{code}
The error message incorrectly says that the source path/URL is incorrect, when it is very much correct—the problem is with the authentication, and the error message should reflect that.

To reproduce:
# Use a repository on a Bitbucket server (locally hosted). Make sure you do not have an SSH key registered with the server.
# Attempt to clone the repository using SSH. The link will correctly kick off a SourceTree clone dialog. Make sure that you’re in Clone New mode.
# At the bottom of the dialog, observe the unhelpful error message.

You should also get this error message if you use a registered, valid SSH key with a password, but then fail the authentication (enter an incorrect password or click Cancel in OS X’s ssh-agent dialog). IIRC you get the same unhelpful message if you connect via HTTPS and fail to enter a correct password, but I have not taken the time to reproduce this.
fields.summary: Bad error message for authentication errors when cloning a repository

fields.description: When attempting to stage a non-contiguous selection, an alert is presented (see screen shot). Rather than admonish the user after the fact, the alert can be avoided by simply not enabling the “Stage Lines” button under disallowed circumstances. That is to say, if ST is incapable of staging a discontiguous selection, the “Stage Lines” button should be disabled when there is a discontiguous selection.
fields.summary: “Non-contiguous selection” alert is avoidable

fields.description:
"Add file" from the Actions menu and the keyboard shortcut both work, so I can use those.

 I was going through the tutorial for creating a Bitbucket repository using SourceTree, and was blocked at the step where I was instructed to use the pop-up menu to add supplies.txt to my space station repository.
fields.summary: When a file appears with a "?" the "Add file" button on the "..." pop-up menu does nothing.

fields.description:
I work on many projects and they are all managed through SourceTree.  I would like the ability to 'tag' a repository as used in a project and then filter only repositories for that project to help me see just those repositories involved with the current project.

This would be more powerful to me than a 'folder' structure that grouped repositories into logical groups since I want a repository to possibly be in more than one project.
fields.summary: Ability to tag repositories by 'project'

fields.description: The diff view will flash white and then redraw occasionally. When it does this, the scroll position resets to the top, which is very annoying when you're scrolling through a diff and have to scroll back down, especially when it keeps happening. The flashing often seems to happen twice in a row. See attached movie for the flashing.
fields.summary: Diff view flashes and resets scroll position

fields.description: At the repository view the loading bars (originated by downloading new repositories) get wrong positioning if you collapse groups.
fields.summary: Loading bars wrong positioning

fields.description:
{quote}In Sourcetrees Preferences, I switched to "System Mercurial" (due to TLS PYthon issues abort: error: EOF occurred in violation of protocol (_ssl.c:590)).
I can not switch back to "Sourcetree Mercurial" as the button is out of reach. The output in "Mercurial Version" is long and thus the button below is outside the screen.
Sourcetree 2.4.1 (97) under OSX 10.11.6{quote}

-- STSP-6134
fields.summary: Text sizing issue on Mercurial version output

fields.description:
When editing a commit message in sourcetree pressing command-delete removes the currently selected file
To match platform conventions it should delete to the beginning of the current line.

For an example of the expected behavior, Finder uses the this key to delete files, but when renaming files, cmd-delete has the expected text editing behaviour
fields.summary: Sourcetree overrides standard CMD-delete hotkey

fields.description:
{quote}The table showing modified files in History View does not adjust it's height correctly and so, if the list of files is long enough that the table needs to scroll, it is difficult (sometimes impossible) to scroll the list to the bottom. In other words, you are not adjusting the content size of the scrollView to match the height of it's frame.
See the attached screenshot - notice that the scrollbar indicator is off the bottom of the screen. The issue gets worse with longer lists of files, or if the bottom panel is a smaller proportion of the window's height.
This has been happening for quite some time - at least a month or two.
Other people on my team also see the same issue.
You can reproduce easily by modifying enough files in your local repo such that the list in the history view is extends below than the on-screen height of the table view.{quote}
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-28 at 6.57.31 pm.png|thumbnail! 

--STSP-6337
fields.summary: Layout issue on the list of modified files in History View

fields.description:
The release notes promise improvements to diff refreshing in this build. However, there is a new regression where the view does not refresh when it should.

1. Make some changes in a file such that there are at least two hunks.
2. Stage one of them.
3. Click between the staged and un-staged entries for the file.

Expected: A diff for the selected hunk is shown.

Actual: The view is not refreshed; either the staged or unstaged hunk—whichever was selected first—remains shown. (Clicking on a different file shakes it loose.)
fields.summary: Diff does not refresh when switching between staged and unstaged hunks

fields.description: GPG path is set to /usr/local/MacGPG2/bin however opening repo with signed commits causes the app to hang. It spins off gpg2 processes but nothing is happening. Entire UI is frozen. It unfreezes after some time, selecting GPG key in Repository -> Repository Settings solves the issue.
fields.summary: SourceTree freeze when using MacGPG2

fields.description:
We've had a few reports of rate limits being applied unexpectedly to users of Bitbucket Cloud.

Customer is not making extensive pushes or pulls from Bitbucket using SourceTree - yet they keep hitting a throttling limit with 429
fields.summary: SourceTree users hitting: The requested URL returned error: 429 (SRCTREE-1144)

fields.description:
I like using the tab-page very much, could you please adding config options such like "always using tab-page" or "always open new repo in new tab-page" or "force using single window“。

Now every time I restart source tree, every repo I opened opening in new window, and I have to drag them into one. That makes me sad. I think this option won't heart other users who like using in muti-windows, and not difficult to implement.

Thanks very much!
fields.summary: Allow setting "always using tab-page instead of windows"

fields.description:
As an advanced user I want to apply stashes quicker, with one click less (not having to click _or think about_ the checkbox), only the options presented in only one way: buttons.

When applying a git stash, currently the confirmation dialog gives me the choice to delete the stash or not via a checkbox. Keeping the selected setting as default for the next procedure.

This is a bit confusing and needs more thinking than necessary for a simple action that should be mostly done by muscle memory. The checkbox and its behaviour bothers me very much.

I would like to have not 2 buttons and a checkbox -> 4 options of which 1 is useless (checkbox + cancel button), but 3 buttons: Cancel, Apply+Delete, Apply+Keep
fields.summary: Better dialog for stash apply

fields.description: This seems to be a regression of SRCTREE-2030 (maybe just in the 2.4 timeframe?); the smart quotes and dashes (and ellipses, etc.) are all automatically replacing their "dumb" (safe, friendly, ASCII) counterparts. This introduces unnecessary encoding issues and makes it very difficult to commit from SourceTree (you can use "undo" to revert the automatic replacements if you are watching what you type very closely).
fields.summary: Commit message input applies smart quotes and dashes

fields.description:
commit 233e137 to 1eca265 is rebased on develop branch.

when i merged 233e137 to master, date-order view was broken.

in short, commit 479cdcc could not found it's ancestor: 233e137.
fields.summary: Date Ordering goes wrong with rebased commit
staging hunk causes staged/unstaged tree to scroll/flicker

fields.description:
When SourceTree performs its regular `git status` (or any forced update by using cmd + R), the right of the window (where you can see the changed lines in the file) updates as well. The update is good, but the scroll position jumps back to the top. Could you please save the scroll position when that happens?

This causes major frustration in our team, especially because SourceTree seems to reload the status quite often; reading a large file then becomes impossible
fields.summary: Refresh of the git status causes the right part to scroll to the top

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user tries to add an account in SourceTree with SSH protocol, they have the option to generate an SSH key pair for this account.
However, they are not given the option to associate an existing SSH key with the account.
h3. Suggested Solution
When adding an account in SourceTree with protocol SSH, allow users to specify the SSH key they use for authentication.
fields.summary: Allow users to associate existing SSH key pairs to an account, when they add an account with SSH as protocol in SourceTree

fields.description: As per this feature request on Twitter: https://twitter.com/TankaMusic/status/842018112111280128
fields.summary: Highlight remote branch in sidebar when selecting local copy

fields.description:
When I have pending files and I want to look at the merged changes, while I scroll in the file I'm looking at, SourceTree makes a periodical refresh which brings me back to the top of the file every time. It is extremely hard to be able to look at all changes if the file is somewhat big. 

Why is that refresh needed to be done so often?
fields.summary: Source file refresh in pending files

fields.description: Feature request via Twitter. Please see corresponding tweet: https://twitter.com/pxl_panda/status/841617286326865920
fields.summary: Have SourceTree remember tabs when re-opening the application

fields.description: There is no "Checkout" button available in the Customize Toolbar options.
fields.summary: Missing Checkout Button in Toolbar

fields.description:
I try to set up SourceTree 2.5 (98) alpha with my Yubikey. I use the Yubikey for 2FA and as storage for my GPG/SSH keys.

I connected successfully with Bitbucket and want to use ssh but SourceTree can't find my ssh key stored on my Yubikey :-(
fields.summary: Can't find my ssh key

fields.description:
I try to set up SourceTree 2.5 (98) alpha with my Yubikey. I use the Yubikey for 2FA and as storage for my GPG/SSH keys.

I clicked on Connect Account and logged in. Now SourceTree asks me for the Verification Code because it can't use my Yubikey.

SourceTree thinks my Chrome is outdated. I think it happens because I use a Beta version of Chrome.
fields.summary: I'm not using latest Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Recently, [Locking feature|https://github.com/git-lfs/git-lfs/blob/master/docs/proposals/locking.md] seems to be released in Git LFS. SourceTree doesn't currently support the feature.

h3. Suggested Solution

Please support the feature in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Support for Locking feature of Git LFS

fields.description:
Customer report - If you have a remote with 256 (or more) branches, the arrow will not appear. As soon as the number of branches is less than 256, the arrow will reappear after a fetch operation.

After the fetch:

!After fetch with less than 256.png!

Original:
 !No Disclosure Triangle.png!
fields.summary: Arrow by the branch disappears if the remote branch is above a certain amount.

fields.description:
Current version is  2.4.1 (97), and it [Detail view of commit message]  has lost since about from 2.3(xxx).

Below is the normal state of source tree, but the view in the red rectangle would lost after some days, and it would not appear again until I reinstall source tree.

!image-2017-03-13-09-39-48-744.png!
fields.summary: Detail view of commit message losts

fields.description:
Currently when you select a branch or commit for checkout in the timeline and choose "checkout existing" you are prompted with another version of the timeline and required to navigate to the branch you just selected and choose it again.  It seems like this should at least default to having selected the branch you just chose...  I'm not even sure why the followup selection prompt is even necessary.

 

thanks.
fields.summary: "Checkout Existing"'s prompt should pre-select the branch the user just chose...
ADD A BIG LABEL ON THE MAIN UI WHEN REBASE IS IN PROGRESS

fields.description:
Current SourceTree version no longer has "New Group" option while right-clicking the repository browser.

It's best to bring back the option so that user no longer need to navigate to *+New Repository(Button)>New Group* to create a new repo group.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/bookmarks-column-repository-browser-overview-781398414.html#BookmarksColumn/RepositoryBrowserOverview-Manipulatingrepositorylists]

 

--STSP-6081
fields.summary: Include "New Group" option in the Right-click menu

fields.description:
1. Press CMD+, will open the "Preferences" window, then switch to "Accounts" tab.
2. Add one account using "Basic" and HTTPS auth, type username and password, this account will be marked as "Default".
3. Then add another account using "Basic" and "SSH" auth, this account will be also marked as "Default".
4. Then select one account, click "Remove" button, alert me confirm delete the selected account.
5. Press "OK", all accounts gone.
fields.summary: Delete all accounts after confirmed the delete selected account prompt

fields.description:
After update to 2.4.1 I started receiving errors about SSH configuration for GitHub accounts. Even though I have none added in the preferences.. (only bitbucket).

This error is shown when openning the repository with remotes in github.

I placed a screenshot here: [http://imgur.com/a/1TD64] because when I attempted to upload it as an attachment to this issue I received this error: http://imgur.com/a/7zDcS
fields.summary: SSH Configuration error

fields.description: When I choose the Branch command, a sheet displays, showing me the current branch and asking me to fill in a name for the new branch, choose a commit to start the branch, and so on. The current branch name is displayed in a standard text editing view, but when I click on it, the app just beeps. I would like the ability to select text from that view so I can copy it (for example, to paste into the new branch field for editing), though of course the view should reject any attempts to change the text.
fields.summary: Branch sheet doesn’t allow selection of current branch name

fields.description:
I believe the new version of SourceTree doesn't properly configure the .ssh/config. My temporary workaround has been modifying it from:
 # — SourceTree Generated —
 Host UNAME
 HostName github.com
 User UNAME
 PreferredAuthentications publickey
 IdentityFile /Users/UNAME/.ssh/UNAME
 UseKeychain yes
 AddKeysToAgent yes
 # ----------------------------

To:

Host *
 IdentityFile ~/.ssh/UNAME

 

---

 

It appears we have a conflict with known_hosts, or we're not setting the account properly
fields.summary: Make sure SourceTree's SSH config is properly set for authentication

fields.description:
When I only want to stage parts of a file, after every "stage chunk" button click, SourceTree for Mac loses my scroll position and resets it to the top of the file. It also flashes weirdly several times before it correctly shows the remaining changes. (See attached screen recording)

If a file contains a large number of changes interspersed with changes that should go into another commit (which often is the case for me after fixing a bug that was actually made up of two related issues interacting that I want committed as separate fixes), this means I constantly need to find my place again after staging, and scroll over the same lines ... again.
fields.summary: Flashing and loss of scroll position when staging selected chunks of a file

fields.description:
{quote}Actual
Creating a remote repo when creating a new local repo does not add the remote repo to the local repo.

Steps
1. Create new local repo
2. Tick 'Also create remote repository'
3. Fill in details - I added on Bitbucket as a private Git repo. This also happens if public. I haven't tested other service providers or repo types.
4. Once created, go to Repository > Repository Settings > Remotes
5. The remote repo you created during setup has not been added and needs adding manually

Expected
The remote repo created during setup is added as origin when creating the repo.

I am using version 2.4.1-Mac but this is not available in the version list.
{quote}
--STSP-6092
fields.summary: 'Also create remote repository' does not add

fields.description:
Hello

I try to reset a file which was delete in last commit, but i have a error if this file don't exits in current branch, i.e. if he was delete.

If I simple touch new file for example with empty body, and try to reset again in this case all work. 

Would you fix this wrong behavior for reset operation?

Thank you!
fields.summary: Reset file to certain commit don't working if file was delete

fields.description:
I have one repository using another as a subtree. Trying to Pull the subtree results in a crash of the command-line tool; the main SourceTree program continues to run with no obvious side-effects.

To reproduce:
# Start with two repositories in BitBucket: one to act as the main project, the other to be included as a subtree. Set up one as a subtree of the other ([example procedure|https://makingsoftware.wordpress.com/2013/02/16/using-git-subtrees-for-repository-separation/]).
# Open the main project repository in SourceTree. You should see the subtree connection under the Subtrees heading.
# Pull the subtree. The only way I’ve found to do this is via the context menu > Pull Subtree… (where’s the main menu bar command?). In the “Are you sure?“ dialog, click OK. (You can try it with or without squashing commits but for me it crashes with a similar backtrace either way.)
# The command-line tool crashes. If you have the OS configured to produce a crash report, that window will come up. In any case, SourceTree shows the backtrace in the command results sheet.
fields.summary: Pulling from a subtree causes a crash in the command-line tool

fields.description:
When using "Copy Branch Name to Clipboard"

on branches with a remote tracking branch

a value like `origin/feature/something` will be coped

I am right-clicking on local branch item, so I think it's a bug.

 

A workaround would be making the local branch stop tracking remote branch.
fields.summary: "Copy Branch Name to Clipboard" incorrectly copied branch name with remote name when tracking branch present

fields.description:
Commit description disappeared from the interface a few months ago after update (I don't remember when exactly). Also commit file list is cut in the interface (the scroll bottom is not the actual list bottom). You can see it in the attached screenshot and video.

 

I didn't do anything abnormal, I just updated the SourceTree app using the built-in updater.
fields.summary: Commit description is not displayed

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some users have reported that adding a GitHub account, and then going to the tab {{Remote}} in SourceTree gives the following error:
 "Refreshing Remote Repositories Failed"
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-24 at 20.45.49.png|thumbnail!

The GitHub credentials are also not stored in Mac's Keychain Access.
h3. Environment

Reported with SourceTree 2.4 (9.6), OSX 10.11.6 (15G1212)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In SourceTree, go to the gear >> Accounts
 # Click {{Add...}}
 # Add a GitHub account, with OAuth and HTTPS and select {{OK}}
 # Afterwards, go to the {{Remote}} tab in SourceTree repo browser

h3. Expected Results

The Remote tab shows the remote GitHub repos
h3. Actual Results

Going to the remote tab, shows this error:   !Screen Shot 2017-02-24 at 20.45.49.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

More details and logs in the linked ticket SAC ticket
 I found this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-4540 but it seems to be specific to GitHub enterprise
fields.summary: Adding a GitHub account in SourceTree is failing in some cases

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the default choice for 'Push branches' option (in SourceTree {{Preferences}} >> tab {{Git}}) is 'simple'. This means that pushing is only allowed if the remote branch has the same name as the local one.

Some users rename the local branch they checkout, e.g.:
remote: origin/test/remoteBranch
local: remoteBranch

and when they attempt to push, SourceTree attempts to push to origin/remoteBranch instead of origin/test/remoteBranch.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make 'upstream' the default 'Push branches' option for SourceTree.
fields.summary: As a user I want 'upstream' to be the default choice for the 'Push branches' option in SourceTree Git Preferences

fields.description:
Observed OS X client - Version 2.3.1 (69)

As a dev I want to create branches in Sourcetree but am bad at typing occasionally so i add a space to end my branch name.

When i attempt to do this I get this message...
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree branch "feature/1234-this-is-a-branch " 
fatal: 'feature/1234-this-is-a-branch ' is not a valid branch name.
Completed with errors, see above{noformat}
Unless you know what the problem is, its not immediately obvious what is wrong.

I would expect the flow to run a standard whitespace trim/chomp on the input string to allow me to create the branch.
fields.summary: Trailing white space in branch name is not stripped

fields.description:
In the context of the 'History' tab under 'Workspace,' viewing the files that were modified doesn't allow for scrolling to the bottom if the number of files changed is larger than the size of section. This makes it impossible to select the file at the bottom of that section when checking for what has changed in that file.

This seems to happen when the size of the of frame made smaller. The scrolling does adjust to being a smaller size.
fields.summary: Scroll for History View Files Doesn't Stay at the Bottom

fields.description: Since a few weeks I'm not able to see more than one modified file per commit (in History view), and apparently there isn't a way to show them back. I'm not sure if it's a bug but still I think that there is something to improve because I don't know what happened. I also tried to uninstall the application.
fields.summary: In history view I can see only one modified file per commit

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Selecting 'TAGS' and 'SHELVED' from the sidebar for Mercurial repos is not working

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Mac 2.4 (96), System Mercurial 3.8.4 (also reproduced with Embedded Mercurial 3.7.3)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a local Mercurial repo in SourceTree
# Open the repository in SourceTree
# Right click on a revision >> {{Tag...}} and add a tag
# Make a change to an existing file
# Select the file and {{Shelve}} the changes

h3. Expected Results
The {{TAGS}} and {{SHELVED}} items on the sidebar should show the tags and shelves respectively.

h3. Actual Results
The {{TAGS}} and {{SHELVED}} items are not clickable and it's not possible for the user to view the tags and shelves in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Selecting 'TAGS' and 'SHELVED' from the sidebar for Mercurial repos is not working

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
 # Open repository from bookmarks and immediately start typing something in the commit     comment box.
 # Comment textarea will periodically drop its focus and you have click with mouse on it again.

MacOS El Captain 10.11.6
PHPStorm
fields.summary: Comment textarea loses focus while refreshing local changes

fields.description:
The merge dialog doesn't have a way to mark that clean merge commits should be signed. Ideally this would also inherit from the behavior in #-SRCTREE-2081- and respect the request to have commits signed (always).

 

The cherrypick workflow doesn't have a way to mark that the cherrypicked commit should be signed either.

 

I'm not sure if there are other potential places where this should apply, these are the two i've encountered so far.
fields.summary: signed commits should also apply to other types of commits

fields.description:
I can't view "Remote Repository" tab, and "push", "fetch", "pull" from or to Bitbucket and also Github becase of "Refershing Remote Repositories Failed". If I click "Sign in" button, I log in Bitbucket and the error come up again. (detail in attachements (.gif and .png))

 

!recode.gif|thumbnail!

 

I did full-uninstall(remove the setting of SourceTree) and reinstalled SourceTree latest version. But situation didn't change..
fields.summary: Refreshing Remote Repositories Failed
fixup/squash commit

fields.description: Please add ability to copy commit description into clipboard by Right Click, Cmd+C or any other method
fields.summary: Copy commit description into clipboard

fields.description: Currently a user is able to see repositories that he created and forked, but not the ones that he starred in Github. It'll be great if SourceTree has the ability to find starred repositories from GitHub.
fields.summary: Ability to find starred repositories from GitHub

fields.description: OAuth connection with github fails. 2FA on github enabled. After connecting SourceTree cannot refresh remote repositories ( Error content: "Could not authorize request with the available token. Please re-authenticate.") . Logging in with github token as password doesn't work too.
fields.summary: Github Integration Problem
GPG error because stgpg.sh doesn't quote arguments

fields.description:
h1. Observed

Using the feature "Jump to Commit SHA-1" with whitespaces like so (without quotation marks):
  
{color:#f79232}" 18eb4c4c3ce"{color}
{color:#59afe1}"18eb4c4c3ce "{color}

...will result in the appearance of a spinner blocking the "Jump to:" drop down field (disappears only after clicking onto another branch) and does not select the desired commit in the tree view.


h1. Expected

Whitespaces are omitted from the hash and the desired commit is selected in the tree view
fields.summary: "Jump to Commit" dysfunctional when containing whitespaces

fields.description:
Trying to perform interactive rebasing makes Sourcetree crash when the branch seems to be big enough. I managed to do the interactive rebasing near the head of the branch.

See attached video.

It used to work better in 2.3.1.
fields.summary: Crash when doing interactive rebasing

fields.description:
1. I could not scroll to the end of list of changed files.
2. Commit log disappears.
fields.summary: UI Problem

fields.description:
After encountering SRCTREE-4574 I changed branches and did a merge. This merge resulted in a number of conflicts, which I had to resolve by hand. I used Cmd-D to perform an external diff, then went back and forth between SourceTree-Beta and BBEdit, comparing and merging lines. At some point, SourceTree-Beta hanged and Activity Monitor showed it using 100% CPU.

I used the Sample button in Activity Monitor to capture a sample of the running process, for what good that does.
fields.summary: SourceTree hanged with 100% CPU usage

fields.description:
I tried checking out an existing branch from our git repository (hosted in Bitbucket running on our server), and the checkout succeeded, but SourceTree-Beta didn’t update the branch list. That is: it did not add the branch to the list of local branches, and it also did not change the bold highlighting indicating the current branch.

This only happened once; upon trying to repeat, the branch list now shows both freshly-checked-out branches and the bold highlighting indicates the correct branch.

Steps that produced the problem:
* From an active JIRA issue, create a branch. This should take you to the Source view in Bitbucket.
* Click the ellipsis (“…”) button next to the branch name. Choose “Check out in SourceTree”.
* The “Checkout [sic] Existing” dialog appears. Click “Checkout [sic]“.
* The transcript of the git command confirms that the checkout succeeded, but the branch list does not update.
fields.summary: Checking out existing git branch did not update branch list

fields.description: After staging a "hunk" (a change) using the right-hand pane of the File Status view, the pane contents autoscroll to the first change in the change set.  This is cumbersome, disorienting and did not occur in 2.3.x.
fields.summary: (2.4) File status hunk List autoscrolls after staging change

fields.description:
When this is usefull:
Using SourceTree, and needing to visually track if a branch has been merged into which other branch.

Current process:
Using a Git repo for example, 8 active branches.
Selecting a branch to go to it's recent commit line in the graph.
Tracing by eye (and very similar color) it's up history to track which branch it has been merged into.
(attached#1: "following the blue line up until you find the merge, No the other blue line.")

Expected process:
Having an option to Highlight the selected branch's graph line from the graph.
The graph line would stay colored, while all other graph lines would blacken and dim.
The graph line can then be visually tracked better to it's merges as it's column shifts.
(attached expected.jpg: "I see where this line is going")
fields.summary: Option to Highlight Branch

fields.description: It seems when the password prompt for ssh key is displayed, it isn't clear that the password is of the ssh keychain. It can be confused for the account password. Can you improve it to indicate its for the ssh key and not repo/account?
fields.summary: confusion around prompt for ssh keychain password

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Git offers the ability to define custom diffs for a repository in {{.git/info/attributes}}. E.g. {code}  *.db diff=sqlite3 {code}

Those custom diffs are not read by SourceTree and in the example above, there is no preview for .db files when viewing a commit in {{History}}.

h3. Suggested Solution
Use Git's custom diffs defined in {{.git/info/attributes}} for generating the diffs in SourceTree
fields.summary: Use custom diffs from .git/info/attributes in SourceTree

fields.description: If the repository browser has lots of visible repositories, the Bitbucket server is hit for each one to retrieve status updates. When subsequently a push is attempted the error "Too many failed authentication attempts" is shown. This can be remedied by putting all repositories into folders and collapsing them, and then waiting a while before trying to push again. Would it be a good idea to just auth once and then retrieve all the status updates, therefore not triggering the oauth throttling?
fields.summary: Oauth throttle exceeded

fields.description:
When a project's path has a space in it and I click the Terminal icon to open a terminal to the current project, I get an error that `-bash: cd: too many arguments`. This is because the space makes it appear that there are two (or more) arguments passed to `cd`.

Escaping the path, or placing the path in quotes will make it possible to use this feature.
fields.summary: Can't open terminal to project if path has spaces

fields.description: With the latest update (2.4), SourceTree requires me to enter my password for my GitHub enterprise account every time. In spite of checking the 'Save in Keychain' checkbox, it doesn't save my credentials and prompts me to enter it every time. It doesn't show up in the 'Saved Accounts' list either. The saved password used to work prior to 2.4. Looks like a regression.
fields.summary: After latest update (2.4), SourceTree doesn't remember credentials for enterprise GitHub accounts

fields.description:
Would be nice if SourecTree would remember the last state of the checkbox.

Benefit: IMHO users usually use the same workflow based on their personal preferences (with or without enabled checkbox). In my case i have to enable that checkbox every time.
fields.summary: As a user I want SoureTree to keep last state of 'keep staged changes' checkbox in the stash dialog

fields.description:
I had been supplying custom avatars (icons for bookmarks window) by putting an image named "icon.jpg" at the top level of a repository. This works on SourceTree-Mac 2.0.5.5, and does not work in SourceTree-Mac 2.4. I tried the "Refresh Avatars" item on the tools menu for the bookmarks window, to no avail.

This may be the same as the issue here: <[https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/17896809/missing-logo-icon-in-sourcetree-window]>
fields.summary: Local custom avatars no longer populate for repositories.

fields.description: "Create patch" and "Apply patch" were translated to "Criar caminho" and "Aplicar caminho" in brazilian portuguese. "Caminho" means path not patch. The correct translation is "Criar remendo" and "Aplicar remendo".
fields.summary: Wrong pt_br translation

fields.description:
In general, clicking on any checked-out branch under BRANCHES, or any branch under REMOTES, in the left-hand nav will immediately select that branch's most recent commit in the main history panel.

There's one (annoying) exception: if I first click on any commit in the history pane to highlight it, then click on my currently-selected checked-out branch in the LH nav, the highlight doesn't change. Clicking any other checked-out or remote branch does select a commit as expected: this only happens with the selected (local HEAD) checked-out branch.

At this point the only way to get that branch's commit selected is to click on one of the _other_ branches in the LH nav, and then click my selected one again.
fields.summary: Clicking on HEAD branch in left nav after highlighting a commit in the history pane does not change the commit highlighted

fields.description: If you create a remote repo on Bitbucket Cloud using the new feature in SourceTree, and check the box that 'This is a private repository', the repo is still created as a PUBLIC repo instead of private.
fields.summary: Remote repo creation for Bitbucket Cloud does not respect private repo creation checkbox.

fields.description:
Main commit window does not respect local 24 hour clock settings.


See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Main commit window does not respect local 24 hour clock settings.

fields.description:
I'm trying copy repository from remote mercurial server using this url:
 ssh://dmitriyp@devbucket.me:2223//home/dev/public_html/flashglobal-new.devbucket.me

Server response: 
 "ssh: connect to host devbucket.me port 22: Connection refused
 fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
 and the repository exists."

As you see, ST use wrong port number to connect. Copying in the console working perfectly.

See video: [https://screencast.com/t/be6ohJe9CDAN]
fields.summary: I can't add new repository. SourceTree uses wrong port.

fields.description:
Just upgraded to 2.4 today.

Commit doesn't seem to respect "Select all files when selecting commit" setting anymore. I have that setting unchecked but commit always selects all files by default. This is different behavior compared to previous versions.
fields.summary: Commit won't always select all files
